# Set up


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# should haves
library(tidyverse)
library(here)
library(lterdatasampler)

# would be nice to have
library(performance)
library(flextable)
library(gtsummary)
library(stargazer)
```
:::


# 1. Linear models

How does stem mass predict stem length?


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
data <- hbr_maples %>% 
  filter(year == 2003 & watershed == "Reference")
```
:::


Look at your data (we've looked at this data set before, so we won't go through it now).  

Then, create some exploratory data visualization:


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data = data, aes(x = stem_dry_mass, y = stem_length)) +
  geom_point()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Untitled_files/figure-html/exploratory-data-visualization-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


Seems like there should be a relationship between dry mass and length! Let's try a model: 


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
modelobject <- lm(stem_length ~ stem_dry_mass, data = data)
```
:::


C

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
plot(modelobject)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Untitled_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-1-1.png){width=672}
:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Untitled_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-1-2.png){width=672}
:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Untitled_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-1-3.png){width=672}
:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Untitled_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-1-4.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
summary(modelobject)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

Call:
lm(formula = stem_length ~ stem_dry_mass, data = data)

Residuals:
    Min      1Q  Median      3Q     Max 
-26.189  -7.926  -2.640   6.686  30.230 

Coefficients:
              Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)    
(Intercept)     60.514      4.249  14.243  < 2e-16 ***
stem_dry_mass  895.501    178.783   5.009 1.94e-06 ***
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1

Residual standard error: 12.71 on 118 degrees of freedom
Multiple R-squared:  0.1753,	Adjusted R-squared:  0.1683 
F-statistic: 25.09 on 1 and 118 DF,  p-value: 1.94e-06
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
table <- stargazer(modelobject)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
